alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 3:14PM PST until December 26 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow...except rain or a mix of rain and snow below 6500 to 7500 feet through Thursday. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 18 inches, except 3 to 7 feet above 7000 feet along and west of Highway 395. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph, except over 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times with areas of strong winds and blowing snow along the 395 corridor. Strong winds could cause tree damage. There may be a break in heavier snow late Friday night and Saturday.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
